title: Slow Looking:  In the Galleries with Artist Kelly Church (October 28)
title_display: Slow Looking:  In the Galleries with Artist Kelly Church
short_description: Ottawa/Pottawatomi/Ojibwe artist, educator, and culture-sharer Kelly Church discusses the materials and tools used in her basket-weaving practice.
list_description: Ottawa/Pottawatomi/Ojibwe artist, educator, and culture-sharer Kelly Church discusses the materials and tools used in her basket-weaving practice.
description:
Drop in to Gallery 135 to meet Kelly Church, Ottawa/Pottawatomi/Ojibwe artist, educator, and culture keeper, who will discuss the materials and tools used in her basket-weaving practice.

“My work tells stories, shares teachings, shows the nature I am influenced by, and the Nature I am affected by," the artist says. "I use my baskets to tell the story of the destruction of the black ash trees by the Emerald ash borer, to combine the traditions of yesterday and today. I create baskets to educate, to humor, to engage people in conversation, to get people to think, to learn, to share, to give a voice the traditions of yesterday and combine these teachings with my role in a contemporary world today."

Two of Church’s artworks are currently on view in the museum’s Arts of the Americas galleries: Black Ash Teachings in Gallery 136 and Sustaining Traditions—Digital Teachings in Gallery 262. Visitors are invited to engage in an informal question and answer session with the artist.

About the Artist

Kelly Church is an Ottawa/Pottawatomi/Ojibwe black ash basket maker, fiber artist, educator, activist and culture keeper. A member of the Gun Lake Band in Michigan and a Grand Traverse Band of Ottawa and Ojibwe descendent, she comes from an unbroken line of black ash basket makers and from the largest black ash weaving family in the Great Lakes region. Learn more about the artist.

If you have any questions about programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu. 

Please note that in-person tours may be canceled or postponed due to unforeseen circumstances.
